>So said Dave Astels on 2003-05-10 --------------------
>--- In junit@yaho=
ogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
>> Mike Bowler got m=
e in the habit of using 'final' where possible, so 
>> I asked him to read =
the article. Here is his response.
>
>
>> >My main reason for using final i=
s to better explain my *intent* to 
>> >the compiler.
>
>Should you be worr=
ied about the compiler?  Shouldn't your focus be on
>expressing your intent=
 to other programmers.

Agreed, but after a one-week adjustment period, wri=
ting 'final' became an unconscious action. It cost nothing.

>
>> >  This g=
ives the compiler the opportunity to....
>> >
>> >1) Provide better warning=
 messages when I make a mistake
>
>
>> >2) Generate faster code
>
>This is =
a total non-issue... at kleast until it becomes an issue.  You
>shouldn't b=
e trying to outthink the compiler.  See Bill Venner's
>interview with Marti=
n Fowler at artima.com  (the last part of it I think)

I don't think it's a=
 question of out-thinking the compiler, but giving the compiler the tools t=
o think better.

>> >The first is significantly more important to me than t=
he second.  
>
>Why?  It's been a long time since I've even looked at compi=
ler output.
>Eclipse pointes me at the problem.  It's my test failure messa=
ges
>that are the critical thing.

Indeed. Perhaps after a while #1 becomes=
 less of an issue.
